TranslatedText: The famous woman in our scene is Josefa Ortiz de Domínguez who is recognized by her nickname, La Corregidora de Querétaro. She was an important figure in the Mexican revolution because she was a leader of the insurgent group, was a source of knowledge about It was the wife of the Corregidor of Queretaro, in one of the viceroyalty of New Spain, and through this relationship, she learned about the plans of her husband and other politicians to stop the rebels and remove them from their weapons so that he could not continue with the uprising. However, she warned the rebels. She identified herself with the struggle of the Creollos, who suffered at the hand of peninsular people and other people from spain who did not give respect to the Creoles.
